result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Gerou was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to 02CF1082.
Credit for 95 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 18 months w/conditions, consecutive to 02CF1082; credit for 95 days served if revoked; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp. Clerk/H. Barnett. Deft pleads guilty. Court finds deft guilty. PSI ordered. DNA sample ordered. SEH set for 1/17/19 at 2pm. Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant Christopher L. Gerou appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk - C. Kreier. MINUTES:   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued. DA  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2018 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2018 at 08:45 am.
